title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Proverbs chapter 7 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Proverbs Chapter 7.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 7:1, what should the son keep?
questions.correctAnswer: My words
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:1 instructs, 'My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.'

questions.question: What is compared to the 'apple of thine eye' in Proverbs 7:2?
questions.correctAnswer: My law
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:2 says, 'Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.'

questions.question: In Proverbs 7:4, who should wisdom be called?
questions.correctAnswer: My sister
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:4 states, 'Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman.'

questions.question: Who does Proverbs 7:5 say wisdom will keep you from?
questions.correctAnswer: The strange woman
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:5 says, 'That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.'

questions.question: Where did the speaker look through to see the young man in Proverbs 7:6?
options: At the window of my house
questions.correctAnswer: At the window of my house
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:6 states, 'For at the window of my house I looked through my casement.'

questions.question: What time of day did the young man go to the woman's house according to Proverbs 7:9?
options: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night
questions.correctAnswer: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:9 says the young man went 'In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night.'

questions.question: How is the woman described in Proverbs 7:10?
options: With the attire of a harlot, and subtil of heart
questions.correctAnswer: With the attire of a harlot, and subtil of heart
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:10 describes the woman as having 'the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.'

questions.question: According to Proverbs 7:14, what has the woman brought with her?
questions.correctAnswer: Peace offerings
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:14 says, 'I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.'

questions.question: What kind of coverings has the woman decked her bed with, according to Proverbs 7:16?
options: Coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: Coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:16 states, 'I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.'

questions.question: Why is the goodman not at home in Proverbs 7:19?
options: He is gone a long journey
questions.correctAnswer: He is gone a long journey
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:19 says, 'For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey.'

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 7:21 says the woman used much fair speech and flattering lips to cause the young man to yield.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:21 states, 'With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.'

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 7:22 compares the young man following the woman to an ox going to the slaughter.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:22 says, 'He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter.'

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 7:27 describes the house of the strange woman as the way to heaven.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:27 describes her house as 'the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.'

questions.question: Complete this verse from Proverbs 7:3: 'Bind them upon thy _______, write them upon the table of thine heart.'
questions.correctAnswer: fingers
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:3 says, 'Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.'

questions.question: According to Proverbs 7:25, what should your heart not do?
questions.correctAnswer: Decline to her ways
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:25 instructs, 'Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.'

medium.title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Proverbs Chapter 7 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 7:1-3 teach us about the importance of spiritual discipline in daily life?
options: By urging us to keep God's commandments close to our hearts and minds
By advising us to avoid all social gatherings
By encouraging us to focus solely on material wealth
By suggesting we ignore wisdom and understanding
questions.correctAnswer: By urging us to keep God's commandments close to our hearts and minds
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:1-3 urges binding God's commandments upon fingers and writing them on the heart, symbolizing constant remembrance and obedience. This reflects spiritual discipline and devotion (Proverbs 7:1-3, 4-5).

questions.question: A young believer is tempted by flattering words that lead away from God's path. Based on Proverbs 7:5, what biblical truth would you share about resisting temptation?
options: Call understanding your close relative and wisdom your sister to help keep you from temptation
Avoid all interaction with people outside the church
Ignore wisdom and follow your heart
Seek only worldly knowledge to protect yourself
questions.correctAnswer: Call understanding your close relative and wisdom your sister to help keep you from temptation
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:4-5 teaches to personify wisdom and understanding as family to guard against the strange woman's flattering words, emphasizing reliance on spiritual insight to avoid temptation.

questions.question: What warning does Proverbs 7:22-23 give about following temptation without wisdom?
options: Following temptation blindly leads to destruction like an ox to slaughter
Temptation always leads to joy and peace
Ignoring temptation will always solve the problem
Temptation is a minor obstacle easily overcome
questions.correctAnswer: Following temptation blindly leads to destruction like an ox to slaughter
questions.explanation: Verses 22-23 compare yielding to temptation to an ox going to slaughter or a bird rushing into a snare unaware, illustrating the danger of ignoring wisdom and the consequences of sin.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 7:24-25 encourage believers to maintain integrity and avoid sinful paths?
options: By urging children to listen carefully and not let their hearts stray into sinful ways
By advising to ignore advice from elders
By suggesting that sin is unavoidable and should be accepted
By instructing to seek worldly pleasures
questions.correctAnswer: By urging children to listen carefully and not let their hearts stray into sinful ways
questions.explanation: These verses call for attentive listening to wisdom and warn against declining to the ways of the strange woman, promoting integrity and vigilance against sin.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 7:26-27 reveal about the consequences of falling into temptation?
options: Many strong men have been wounded and slain, and her house leads to death
Temptation is a sign of strength
questions.correctAnswer: Many strong men have been wounded and slain, and her house leads to death
questions.explanation: These verses warn that many have been harmed by following the strange woman, whose house leads down to chambers of death, highlighting the fatal consequences of sin.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 7:6-8, what characteristic describes the young man who falls into temptation?
options: He is simple and void of understanding
questions.correctAnswer: He is simple and void of understanding
questions.explanation: Verses 7-8 describe the young man as simple and lacking understanding, highlighting how lack of wisdom can lead to poor decisions and temptation.

questions.question: What lesson about marriage and faithfulness can be drawn from Proverbs 7:10-12?
options: The adulterous woman is restless and cunning, waiting to ensnare the unwise
Marriage is unimportant and can be ignored
Faithfulness has no impact on spiritual life
questions.correctAnswer: The adulterous woman is restless and cunning, waiting to ensnare the unwise
questions.explanation: These verses describe the woman as loud, stubborn, and waiting at corners to trap the unwise, teaching the importance of guarding faithfulness and avoiding temptation.

questions.question: Based on Proverbs 7:13-20, what strategy does the adulterous woman use to entice the young man?
options: She uses flattering speech, kisses, and promises of pleasure in the absence of her husband
She rebukes him harshly to discourage him
She avoids all contact with him
She encourages him to seek wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: She uses flattering speech, kisses, and promises of pleasure in the absence of her husband
questions.explanation: Verses 13-20 show the woman kissing the young man and using smooth, flattering words, claiming her husband is away, to entice him into sin.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 7:2 emphasize the value of God's commandments in a believer's life?
options: They are as precious as the apple of the eye and are essential for life
questions.correctAnswer: They are as precious as the apple of the eye and are essential for life
questions.explanation: Verse 2 compares God's commandments to the apple of the eye, symbolizing utmost care and protection, and associates obedience with life itself.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 7:24-25 teaches that the heart should be inclined to the ways of the strange woman.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:25 explicitly commands not to let the heart decline to her ways or go astray in her paths, warning against temptation.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 7:20 indicates that the husband’s absence is a reason for the young man to be cautious.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 20 notes the husband has gone on a long journey, which the adulterous woman uses to entice the young man, implying caution is necessary.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Proverbs 7:3 advises to "Bind them upon thy ____, write them upon the table of thine heart."
questions.correctAnswer: fingers
questions.explanation: Verse 3 instructs to bind the commandments upon thy fingers and write them on the heart, symbolizing constant remembrance and obedience.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 7:4 teach about viewing wisdom and understanding in our spiritual life?
options: By calling wisdom our sister and understanding our kinswoman, emphasizing their close relationship
By ignoring wisdom and focusing on wealth
By treating understanding as an enemy
By relying solely on human knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: By calling wisdom our sister and understanding our kinswoman, emphasizing their close relationship
questions.explanation: Verse 4 personifies wisdom and understanding as family, encouraging close embrace and reliance on them for spiritual guidance.

questions.question: What spiritual application can be drawn from Proverbs 7:21 regarding the power of speech?
options: Flattering lips can lead someone to yield to temptation
Speech has no impact on actions
Harsh words are the best way to teach wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: Flattering lips can lead someone to yield to temptation
questions.explanation: Verse 21 highlights how fair and flattering speech can cause one to yield, teaching the importance of guarding the heart against seductive words.

questions.question: Based on Proverbs 7:26, what does the chapter warn about the strength of those who fall into temptation?
options: Even strong men can be wounded and slain by sin
Only the weak are affected by sin
questions.correctAnswer: Even strong men can be wounded and slain by sin
questions.explanation: Verse 26 states that many strong men have been slain by the strange woman, emphasizing that no one is immune to the dangers of sin.

hard.title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Proverbs Chapter 7.

questions.question: In Proverbs 7, the 'strange woman' is described as flattering with her words. What literary device is primarily used in the portrayal of this woman to emphasize her danger?
questions.correctAnswer: Allegory
questions.explanation: The chapter uses the 'strange woman' allegorically to represent temptation and folly, as seen in Proverbs 7:5 where she is a symbol for seduction leading to destruction.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'the apple of thine eye' in Proverbs 7:2, and how does it relate to ancient Near Eastern cultural values?
options: It denotes something precious and carefully protected
It refers to a literal apple fruit symbolizing wisdom
It signifies blindness to the commandments
It is a metaphor for the sun and its light
questions.correctAnswer: It denotes something precious and carefully protected
questions.explanation: In ancient Near Eastern culture, the 'apple of the eye' referred to the pupil, a delicate and valuable part of the body, symbolizing the importance of God's commandments (Proverbs 7:2).

questions.question: Proverbs 7:4 personifies wisdom and understanding as 'sister' and 'kinswoman.' What does this familial imagery suggest about the relationship between wisdom and the reader?
options: That wisdom and understanding are close and intimate, like family
That wisdom is distant and unrelated
That wisdom is an enemy to understanding
That wisdom is a stranger to the reader
questions.correctAnswer: That wisdom and understanding are close and intimate, like family
questions.explanation: The use of familial terms indicates that wisdom and understanding are to be embraced intimately and personally, encouraging the reader to value them highly (Proverbs 7:4).

questions.question: Which New Testament passage most directly echoes the warning against the 'strange woman' in Proverbs 7 through the theme of avoiding sexual immorality?
questions.correctAnswer: 1 Corinthians 6:18
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 6:18 instructs believers to flee sexual immorality, paralleling the Proverbs 7 warning to avoid the seductive 'strange woman' (Proverbs 7:5-27).

questions.question: The young man in Proverbs 7:7-8 is described as 'void of understanding.' How does this characterization function as a literary device in the narrative?
options: It serves as a foil to wisdom
It is an example of irony
It is a metaphor for physical blindness
It is an allusion to prophetic figures
questions.correctAnswer: It serves as a foil to wisdom
questions.explanation: The young man’s lack of understanding contrasts with the wisdom personified earlier, highlighting the consequences of ignoring wisdom (Proverbs 7:7-8).

questions.question: In Proverbs 7:10-12, the woman is described as 'subtil of heart' and 'loud and stubborn.' What Hebrew term underlies 'subtil,' and what is its connotation in this context?
questions.correctAnswer: ‘arum’ meaning crafty or shrewd
questions.explanation: The Hebrew word ‘arum’ often denotes craftiness or shrewdness with a negative connotation, fitting the depiction of the seductress (Proverbs 7:10).

questions.question: What is the significance of the setting 'in the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night' (Proverbs 7:9) in the cultural and literary context of ancient Israel?
options: It symbolizes moral darkness and the cover of sin
It marks a time of prayer and worship
It is a metaphor for enlightenment
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes moral darkness and the cover of sin
questions.explanation: The darkness and twilight symbolize the time of secretive and immoral activity, enhancing the warning tone of the passage (Proverbs 7:9).

questions.question: How does the description of the woman’s bed adorned with 'tapestry, carved works, and fine linen of Egypt' (Proverbs 7:16) reflect historical trade and cultural symbolism in the ancient Near East?
options: It indicates luxurious wealth and foreign influence
questions.correctAnswer: It indicates luxurious wealth and foreign influence
questions.explanation: Egyptian fine linens and tapestries were known luxury items, indicating the woman’s seductive allure through wealth and exoticism (Proverbs 7:16).

questions.question: The young man is compared to an 'ox going to the slaughter' in Proverbs 7:22. What is the theological implication of this simile in the context of the chapter?
options: It implies inevitable destruction due to folly
It symbolizes sacrifice accepted by God
questions.correctAnswer: It implies inevitable destruction due to folly
questions.explanation: The simile depicts the young man’s foolishness leading him blindly to ruin, reinforcing the chapter’s theme of warning against temptation (Proverbs 7:22).

questions.question: Which Old Testament book similarly uses the motif of the 'strange woman' or adulteress to symbolize idolatry and unfaithfulness to God?
questions.correctAnswer: Hosea
questions.explanation: The book of Hosea extensively uses the metaphor of unfaithful women to represent Israel's spiritual adultery, paralleling Proverbs 7's use of the 'strange woman' (Proverbs 7:5-27).

questions.question: According to Proverbs 7:21-23, what is the consequence of following the woman’s flattering speech?
options: A dart strikes through his liver, symbolizing deadly consequences
questions.correctAnswer: A dart strikes through his liver, symbolizing deadly consequences
questions.explanation: The imagery of a dart piercing the liver metaphorically shows the fatal damage caused by succumbing to temptation (Proverbs 7:22-23).

questions.question: The phrase 'Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death' (Proverbs 7:27) utilizes which Hebrew word that often denotes the grave or the realm of the dead?
questions.correctAnswer: Sheol
questions.explanation: The term 'Sheol' is the Hebrew word for the grave or underworld, emphasizing the deadly spiritual consequences of following the adulteress (Proverbs 7:27).

questions.question: Which structural literary device is evident in the way Proverbs 7 begins with instructions about wisdom and ends with a vivid warning about folly and death?
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm
questions.explanation: The chapter’s structure forms a chiasm, starting and ending with contrasting themes of wisdom and folly, highlighting the consequences of choices (Proverbs 7:1 and 7:27).

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 7 explicitly instructs to 'bind commandments upon thy fingers' as a metaphor for constant mindfulness of God's law.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:3 uses this metaphor to emphasize the importance of internalizing and remembering the commandments constantly.

questions.question: In Proverbs 7:19-20, the 'goodman' is said to be gone on a long journey with a bag of money. How might this reflect societal norms and gender roles in the ancient Near East?
options: Men often traveled for trade or work, leaving women to manage the household
Women commonly traveled with money for business
Children were responsible for money management
questions.correctAnswer: Men often traveled for trade or work, leaving women to manage the household
questions.explanation: This reflects historical context where men were typically away for extended periods, influencing the narrative's caution about faithfulness (Proverbs 7:19-20).

theological.title: Proverbs Chapter 7 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Proverbs Chapter 7 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 7, what is the primary reason the father urges his son to keep commandments and wisdom?
options: To live and avoid the path of the adulterous woman
To gain wealth and honor among men
To be respected by kings and rulers
To be able to teach others effectively
questions.correctAnswer: To live and avoid the path of the adulterous woman
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:1-5 emphasizes keeping commandments and wisdom so one may live and be kept from the strange woman (Proverbs 7:1-5). This teaching aligns with Deuteronomy 30:15-20 which links obedience to life, and Jesus' teaching in John 14:15 about keeping commandments as an expression of love and life. Psalm 119:9-11 also connects keeping God's word with purity and life.

questions.question: In Proverbs 7, how is wisdom personified in relation to the reader?
questions.correctAnswer: As a sister and kinswoman
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:4 calls wisdom 'my sister' and understanding 'thy kinswoman,' personifying wisdom as close family, inviting intimacy and respect. This complements Proverbs 8:1-3 where wisdom speaks as a person, and the New Testament's presentation of Christ as the embodiment of divine wisdom (1 Corinthians 1:24). James 1:5 urges believers to seek wisdom from God.

questions.question: What does the 'strange woman' in Proverbs 7 primarily use to ensnare the young man?
questions.correctAnswer: Flattering words and fair speech
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:5 and 7:21 show that the strange woman uses flattering words and fair speech to entice the young man. This aligns with biblical warnings against seductive speech and deceit (Psalm 5:9, Colossians 2:8). James 3:6 warns that the tongue can set a person on fire, and 2 Timothy 3:13 warns of those who use smooth talk to deceive.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'apple of thine eye' in Proverbs 7:2 signify about the law?
options: It is of utmost importance and value
It is something to be feared
questions.correctAnswer: It is of utmost importance and value
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:2 describes the law as the 'apple of thine eye,' an expression denoting something precious and carefully protected. Deuteronomy 32:10 and Zechariah 2:8 use similar imagery for God's care. Jesus references this in Matthew 6:22-23 emphasizing the eye as the lamp of the body, linking spiritual focus to life. Psalm 17:8 also uses this phrase indicating protection and value.

questions.question: What is the spiritual consequence described in Proverbs 7:27 for those who follow the adulterous woman?
options: Her house leads to hell and chambers of death
She brings great wealth but no peace
She causes temporary shame but eventual honor
She delivers enlightenment but no salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Her house leads to hell and chambers of death
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:27 warns that the adulterous woman's house leads to hell and the chambers of death, symbolizing eternal judgment and destruction. This is consistent with Proverbs 5:5, 9:18 and the New Testament's warnings about sin leading to death (Romans 6:23). Jesus speaks of hell (Gehenna) as the ultimate destination for sin (Matthew 10:28). Hebrews 10:26-27 also warns of judgment for deliberate sin.

questions.question: How does the young man in Proverbs 7 respond to the woman’s enticements, according to the text?
options: He yields to her with flattering speech and goes after her
He rebukes her and walks away
He calls for help from his father
He ignores her and stays on his path
questions.correctAnswer: He yields to her with flattering speech and goes after her
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:21-22 describes how the young man is enticed by the woman's flattering speech and yields, following her as an ox to the slaughter. This illustrates human susceptibility to temptation and aligns with James 1:14-15 about desire leading to sin and death. Romans 7:15-20 also describes the internal struggle with sin.

questions.question: What does the imagery of the young man going 'as an ox to the slaughter' in Proverbs 7:22 imply about his situation?
options: He is unaware and helplessly heading toward destruction
He is willing and joyful in his decision
He is strong and victorious over temptation
questions.correctAnswer: He is unaware and helplessly heading toward destruction
questions.explanation: The simile in Proverbs 7:22 compares the young man to an ox going to slaughter, implying ignorance and helplessness in his path to ruin. This echoes Isaiah 53:7 where the suffering servant is led like a lamb to the slaughter. 1 Corinthians 15:32 contrasts death's victory, and Hebrews 12:1-2 urges believers to run with purpose, unlike the naive man here.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 7:3 instruct the son to do with the commandments?
options: Bind them upon thy fingers and write them upon the table of thine heart
Teach them publicly in the synagogue
Share them only with close friends
questions.correctAnswer: Bind them upon thy fingers and write them upon the table of thine heart
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:3 commands that commandments be bound on the fingers and written on the heart, symbolizing total internalization and constant remembrance. This parallels Deuteronomy 6:6-8 which commands God's word to be on the heart and hands. Psalm 119:11 expresses hiding God's word in the heart to avoid sin, and Colossians 3:16 encourages letting the word dwell richly within.

questions.question: What reason does the adulterous woman give in Proverbs 7:14 for being outside to meet the young man?
options: She has peace offerings and has paid her vows
She is looking for someone to help her
She is delivering a message from her husband
questions.correctAnswer: She has peace offerings and has paid her vows
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:14 shows the woman claiming to have peace offerings and that she has paid her vows to justify her being out. This is deceptive, masking sin with religious language. This echoes warnings in Isaiah 1:11-17 about meaningless offerings without repentance, and Jesus’ critique of hypocritical worship in Matthew 15:7-9. Hebrews 10:22 calls for sincere hearts, not empty rituals.

questions.question: Why does the adulterous woman say the 'goodman' is not at home in Proverbs 7:19-20?
options: He is gone on a long journey and has taken a bag of money
He is sick and unable to defend her
He is away at war with the king
He is visiting relatives in another town
questions.correctAnswer: He is gone on a long journey and has taken a bag of money
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:19-20 states the 'goodman' is away on a long journey with money, implying opportunity for the woman’s illicit actions. This highlights how sin exploits absence and vulnerability, similar to the temptation of David and Bathsheba in 2 Samuel 11. Galatians 6:7 warns that sowing to the flesh leads to ruin, and Proverbs 21:25-26 show the danger of neglecting duty.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'her feet abide not in her house' in Proverbs 7:11 suggest about the woman's character?
options: She is restless and constantly seeking new victims
She is a recluse and avoids the public
She is a traveler for trade
questions.correctAnswer: She is restless and constantly seeking new victims
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:11 says her feet do not stay in her house, indicating she is constantly roaming and lying in wait, reflecting instability and predatory behavior. This aligns with the New Testament warnings about the devil prowling like a roaring lion seeking to devour (1 Peter 5:8). Proverbs 6:26 also warns about the adulterous woman seeking victims.

questions.question: What does the father in Proverbs 7 urge the children to do in verses 24-25?
options: Hear and attend to his words, and do not let your heart stray to her ways
Ignore all women and live in isolation
Focus only on wealth and power
Trust their own understanding above all
questions.correctAnswer: Hear and attend to his words, and do not let your heart stray to her ways
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:24-25 exhorts children to listen carefully and not allow their hearts to be led astray by the adulterous woman's paths. This teaching echoes Proverbs 3:5-6 about trusting the Lord rather than one’s own understanding. Jeremiah 17:9 warns about the deceitfulness of the heart, and Matthew 6:21 links the heart to one’s life direction.

questions.question: How is the young man described in Proverbs 7:7 before encountering the woman?
options: Void of understanding and among the simple ones
Powerful and wise beyond his years
Faithful and obedient to his father
questions.correctAnswer: Void of understanding and among the simple ones
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:7 describes the young man as 'void of understanding' among the simple, indicating naivety and lack of discernment. This fits with Proverbs 1:22’s call for fools to learn prudence and the New Testament’s call for spiritual maturity (Hebrews 5:14). Psalm 119:130 shows the word of God gives understanding.

questions.question: What does the presence of the woman ‘with attire of a harlot, and subtil of heart’ in Proverbs 7:10 signify about her nature?
options: She is seductive and deceitful in heart
questions.correctAnswer: She is seductive and deceitful in heart
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:10 describes the woman as having the attire of a harlot and being subtil (crafty) of heart, indicating seductive and deceitful intent. This aligns with biblical warnings about false teachers and seducers (2 Timothy 3:13, 2 Corinthians 11:14). Jesus warns about wolves in sheep's clothing (Matthew 7:15).

questions.question: What is the significance of the woman decking her bed with 'coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt' in Proverbs 7:16?
options: It symbolizes temptation adorned with luxury and allure
It shows her poverty and humility
It represents her devotion to God
It indicates her readiness for a wedding
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes temptation adorned with luxury and allure
questions.explanation: Proverbs 7:16 illustrates the woman decorating her bed with luxurious items, symbolizing temptation dressed attractively to entice the young man. This matches the biblical motif that sin often appears attractive (Genesis 3:6). James 1:14-15 describes desire leading to sin, and 1 John 2:16 warns that the lust of the flesh and eyes entices.
